meanings.definition: Involving or relating to the interchangeability of two elements in a mathematical operation.
meanings.sent1: The commutative property allows us to switch the order of numbers in an addition problem.
meanings.sent2: Math problems with commutative operations can be solved in different orders.
meanings.sent3: I tried to swap the numbers in the equation, but the commutative rule caught me off guard.
meanings.sent4: Her flexible thinking was like the commutative nature of numbers, always ready to be rearranged.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the commutative property is like having a secret code to unlock math puzzles.
